result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Martez Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in an opinion filed March 3, 2022 that:  Judgment and order affirmed.
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

The court having filed its opinion in each of the above-entitled appeals and the court having concluded pursuant to Wis. Stats. 809.23 that the opinions should not be published.
IT IS ORDERED that the opinion in each of the above-entitled appeals not be published in the official reports.
Petition for Review filed with Supreme Court

IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee.  This order waives only the filing fees in the Supreme Court.  It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose.

IT IS ORDERED that this petition shall be deemed a timely petition for review.  However a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by April 25, 2022.  If the statement in support is not filed by that time this matter may be summarily dismissed.
Judgment and order affirmed.
IT IS ORDERED that the time to file the respondent's brief is extended to July 8, 2021.
IT IS ORDERED that the time to file a postconviction motion is extended to June 24, 2020.    IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to file a notice of appeal is extended to September 10, 2020.
Court of Appeals received record

IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee.  This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals.  It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose.
